arc_fitting.label: Arc fitting
arc_fitting.tooltip: Enable to get a G-code file which has G2 and G3 moves. G-code resolution will be used as the fitting tolerance.

autoemit_temperature_commands.label: Emit temperature commands automatically
autoemit_temperature_commands.tooltip:
When enabled, PrusaSlicer will check whether your custom Start G-Code contains G-codes to set extruder, bed or chamber temperature (M104, M109, M140, M190, M141 and M191). If so, the temperatures will not be emitted automatically so you're free to customize the order of heating commands and other custom actions. Note that you can use placeholder variables for all PrusaSlicer settings, so you can put a "M109 S[first_layer_temperature]" command wherever you want.
If your custom Start G-Code does NOT contain these G-codes, PrusaSlicer will execute the Start G-Code after heated chamber was set to its temperature, bed reached its target temperature and extruder just started heating.

When disabled, PrusaSlicer will NOT emit commands to heat up extruder, bed or chamber, leaving all to Custom Start G-Code.

automatic_extrusion_widths.label: Automatic extrusion widths calculation
automatic_extrusion_widths.tooltip: Automatically calculates extrusion widths based on the nozzle diameter of the currently used extruder. This setting is essential for printing with different nozzle diameters.

automatic_infill_combination.label: Automatic infill combination
automatic_infill_combination.tooltip: This feature automatically combines infill of several layers and speeds up your print by extruding thicker infill layers while preserving thin perimeters, thus maintaining accuracy.

automatic_infill_combination_max_layer_h.label: Automatic infill combination - Max layer height
automatic_infill_combination_max_layer_h.tooltip: Maximum layer height for combining infill when automatic infill combining is enabled. Maximum layer height could be specified either as an absolute in millimeters value or as a percentage of nozzle diameter. For printing with different nozzle diameters, it is recommended to use percentage value over absolute value.

avoid_crossing_curled_overhangs.label: Avoid crossing curled overhangs (Experimental)
avoid_crossing_curled_overhangs.tooltip: Plan travel moves such that the extruder avoids areas where the filament may be curled up. This is mostly happening on steeper rounded overhangs and may cause a crash with the nozzle. This feature slows down both the print and the G-code generation.

avoid_crossing_perimeters.label: Avoid crossing perimeters
avoid_crossing_perimeters.tooltip: Optimize travel moves in order to minimize the crossing of perimeters. This is mostly useful with Bowden extruders which suffer from oozing. This feature slows down both the print and the G-code generation.

avoid_crossing_perimeters_max_detour.label: Avoid crossing perimeters - Max detour length
avoid_crossing_perimeters_max_detour.tooltip: The maximum detour length for avoid crossing perimeters. If the detour is longer than this value, avoid crossing perimeters is not applied for this travel path. Detour length could be specified either as an absolute value or as percentage (for example 50%) of a direct travel path.

bed_temperature.label: Other layers
bed_temperature.tooltip: Bed temperature for layers after the first one. Set this to zero to disable bed temperature control commands in the output.

bed_temperature_extruder.label: Bed temperature by extruder
bed_temperature_extruder.tooltip: The extruder which determines bed temperatures. Set to 0 to determine temperatures based on the first printing extruder of the first and the second layers.

before_layer_gcode.label: Before layer change G-code
before_layer_gcode.tooltip: This custom code is inserted at every layer change, right before the Z move. Note that you can use placeholder variables for all Slic3r settings as well as [layer_num] and [layer_z].

between_objects_gcode.label: Between objects G-code
between_objects_gcode.tooltip: This code is inserted between objects when using sequential printing. By default extruder and bed temperature are reset using non-wait command; however if M104, M109, M140 or M190 are detected in this custom code, Slic3r will not add temperature commands. Note that you can use placeholder variables for all Slic3r settings, so you can put a "M109 S[first_layer_temperature]" command wherever you want.

binary_gcode.label: Supports binary G-code
binary_gcode.tooltip: Enable, if the firmware supports binary G-code format (bgcode). To generate .bgcode files, make sure you have binary G-code enabled in Configuration->Preferences->Other.

bottom_fill_pattern.label: Bottom fill pattern
bottom_fill_pattern.tooltip: Fill pattern for bottom infill. This only affects the bottom external visible layer, and not its adjacent solid shells.

bottom_solid_layers.label: Bottom
bottom_solid_layers.tooltip: Number of solid layers to generate on bottom surfaces.

bottom_solid_min_thickness.label: Bottom
bottom_solid_min_thickness.tooltip: The number of bottom solid layers is increased above bottom_solid_layers if necessary to satisfy minimum thickness of bottom shell.

bridge_acceleration.label: Bridge
bridge_acceleration.tooltip: This is the acceleration your printer will use for bridges. Set zero to disable acceleration control for bridges.

bridge_angle.label: Bridging angle
bridge_angle.tooltip: Bridging angle override. If left to zero, the bridging angle will be calculated automatically. Otherwise the provided angle will be used for all bridges. Use 180° for zero angle.

bridge_fan_speed.label: Bridges fan speed
bridge_fan_speed.tooltip: This fan speed is enforced during all bridges and overhangs.

bridge_flow_ratio.label: Bridge flow ratio
bridge_flow_ratio.tooltip: This factor affects the amount of plastic for bridging. You can decrease it slightly to pull the extrudates and prevent sagging, although default settings are usually good and you should experiment with cooling (use a fan) before tweaking this.

brim_separation.label: Brim separation gap
brim_separation.tooltip: Offset of brim from the printed object. The offset is applied after the elephant foot compensation.

brim_type.label: Brim type
brim_type.tooltip: The places where the brim will be printed around each object on the first layer.

brim_width.label: Brim width
brim_width.tooltip: The horizontal width of the brim that will be printed around each object on the first layer. When raft is used, no brim is generated (use raft_first_layer_expansion).

chamber_minimal_temperature.label: Minimal
chamber_minimal_temperature.tooltip:
Minimal chamber temperature that the printer waits for before the print starts. This allows to start the print before the nominal chamber temperature is reached.
When set to zero, the minimal chamber temperature is not set in the G-code.

chamber_temperature.label: Nominal
chamber_temperature.tooltip:
Required chamber temperature for the print.
When set to zero, the nominal chamber temperature is not set in the G-code.

color_change_gcode.label: Color change G-code
color_change_gcode.tooltip: This G-code will be used as a code for the color change

colorprint_heights.label: Colorprint height
colorprint_heights.tooltip: Heights at which a filament change is to occur.

compatible_printers_condition.label: Compatible printers condition
compatible_printers_condition.tooltip: A boolean expression using the configuration values of an active printer profile. If this expression evaluates to true, this profile is considered compatible with the active printer profile.

compatible_prints_condition.label: Compatible print profiles condition
compatible_prints_condition.tooltip: A boolean expression using the configuration values of an active print profile. If this expression evaluates to true, this profile is considered compatible with the active print profile.

complete_objects.label: Complete individual objects
complete_objects.tooltip: When printing multiple objects or copies, this feature will complete each object before moving onto next one (and starting it from its bottom layer). This feature is useful to avoid the risk of ruined prints. Slic3r should warn and prevent you from extruder collisions, but beware.

cooling.label: Enable auto cooling
cooling.tooltip: This flag enables the automatic cooling logic that adjusts print speed and fan speed according to layer printing time.

cooling_perimeter_transition_distance.label: Perimeter transition distance
cooling_perimeter_transition_distance.tooltip: Distance in millimeters before non-slowed perimeters where the original unslowed print speed is restored. This reduces print quality issues when transitioning from heavily slowed feature to fast perimeter printing.

cooling_slowdown_logic.label: Cooling slowdown logic
cooling_slowdown_logic.tooltip: Determines how the printer slows down layer printing when the minimum layer time isn't reached. 'Consistent surface' first tries to preserve the print speeds of the first two perimeters by slowing all other features. Only if this isn't sufficient, it also slows down those first two perimeters. 'Uniform cooling' slows down all print features, including the first two perimeters.

cooling_tube_length.label: Cooling tube length
cooling_tube_length.tooltip: Length of the cooling tube to limit space for cooling moves inside it.

cooling_tube_retraction.label: Cooling tube position
cooling_tube_retraction.tooltip: Distance of the center-point of the cooling tube from the extruder tip.

custom_parameters_filament.label: Custom filament parameters
custom_parameters_filament.tooltip:
JSON-encoded string defining extra parameters, which can later be expanded in Custom G-code macro language. Each of the parameters is prepended by %1% prefix before it is passed into the parser. For example, defining '{"my_key": "my_value"}' allows to use '%1%_my_key'.

The JSON must be single level (no arrays and objects). All value types are allowed, but nulls will be rejected by the parser.

custom_parameters_print.label: Custom print parameters
custom_parameters_print.tooltip:
JSON-encoded string defining extra parameters, which can later be expanded in Custom G-code macro language. Each of the parameters is prepended by %1% prefix before it is passed into the parser. For example, defining '{"my_key": "my_value"}' allows to use '%1%_my_key'.

The JSON must be single level (no arrays and objects). All value types are allowed, but nulls will be rejected by the parser.

custom_parameters_printer.label: Custom printer parameters
custom_parameters_printer.tooltip:
JSON-encoded string defining extra parameters, which can later be expanded in Custom G-code macro language. Each of the parameters is prepended by %1% prefix before it is passed into the parser. For example, defining '{"my_key": "my_value"}' allows to use '%1%_my_key'.

The JSON must be single level (no arrays and objects). All value types are allowed, but nulls will be rejected by the parser.

default_acceleration.label: Default
default_acceleration.tooltip: This is the acceleration your printer will be reset to after the role-specific acceleration values are used (perimeter/infill). Set zero to prevent resetting acceleration at all.

default_filament_profile.label: Default filament profile
default_filament_profile.tooltip: Default filament profile associated with the current printer profile. On selection of the current printer profile, this filament profile will be activated.

default_print_profile.label: Default print profile
default_print_profile.tooltip: Default print profile associated with the current printer profile. On selection of the current printer profile, this print profile will be activated.

deretract_speed.label: Deretraction Speed
deretract_speed.tooltip: The speed for loading of a filament into extruder after retraction (it only applies to the extruder motor). If left to zero, the retraction speed is used.

disable_fan_first_layers.label: Disable fan for the first
disable_fan_first_layers.tooltip: You can set this to a positive value to disable fan at all during the first layers, so that it does not make adhesion worse.

dont_support_bridges.label: Don't support bridges
dont_support_bridges.tooltip: Experimental option for preventing support material from being generated under bridged areas.

draft_shield.label: Draft shield
draft_shield.tooltip:
With draft shield active, the skirt will be printed skirt_distance from the object, possibly intersecting brim.
Enabled = skirt is as tall as the highest printed object.
Limited = skirt is as tall as specified by skirt_height.
This is useful to protect an ABS or ASA print from warping and detaching from print bed due to wind draft.

duplicate_distance.label: Distance between copies
duplicate_distance.tooltip: Distance used for the auto-arrange feature of the plater.

elefant_foot_compensation.label: Elephant foot compensation
elefant_foot_compensation.tooltip: The first layer will be shrunk in the XY plane by the configured value to compensate for the 1st layer squish aka an Elephant Foot effect.

enable_dynamic_fan_speeds.label: Enable dynamic fan speeds
enable_dynamic_fan_speeds.tooltip: This setting enables dynamic fan speed control on overhangs.

enable_dynamic_overhang_speeds.label: Enable dynamic overhang speeds
enable_dynamic_overhang_speeds.tooltip: This setting enables dynamic speed control on overhangs.

end_filament_gcode.label: End G-code
end_filament_gcode.tooltip: This end procedure is inserted at the end of the output file, before the printer end gcode (and before any toolchange from this filament in case of multimaterial printers). Note that you can use placeholder variables for all PrusaSlicer settings. If you have multiple extruders, the gcode is processed in extruder order.
end_filament_gcode.default_value: "; Filament-specific end gcode \n;END gcode for filament\n"

end_gcode.label: End G-code
end_gcode.tooltip: This end procedure is inserted at the end of the output file. Note that you can use placeholder variables for all PrusaSlicer settings.
end_gcode.default_value:
M104 S0 ; turn off temperature
G28 X0  ; home X axis
M84     ; disable motors

ensure_vertical_shell_thickness.label: Ensure vertical shell thickness
ensure_vertical_shell_thickness.tooltip: Add solid infill near sloping surfaces to guarantee the vertical shell thickness (top+bottom solid layers).

external_perimeter_acceleration.label: External perimeters
external_perimeter_acceleration.tooltip: This is the acceleration your printer will use for external perimeters. Set zero to use the value for perimeters.

external_perimeter_extrusion_width.label: External perimeters
external_perimeter_extrusion_width.tooltip: Set this to a non-zero value to set a manual extrusion width for external perimeters. If left zero, default extrusion width will be used if set, otherwise 1.125 x nozzle diameter will be used. If expressed as percentage (for example 200%), it will be computed over layer height.

external_perimeter_speed.label: External perimeters
external_perimeter_speed.tooltip: This separate setting will affect the speed of external perimeters (the visible ones). If expressed as percentage (for example: 80%) it will be calculated on the perimeters speed setting above. Set to zero for auto.

external_perimeters_first.label: External perimeters first
external_perimeters_first.tooltip: Print contour perimeters from the outermost one to the innermost one instead of the default inverse order.

extra_loading_move.label: Extra loading distance
extra_loading_move.tooltip: When set to zero, the distance the filament is moved from parking position during load is exactly the same as it was moved back during unload. When positive, it is loaded further,  if negative, the loading move is shorter than unloading.

extra_perimeters.label: Extra perimeters if needed
extra_perimeters.tooltip: Add more perimeters when needed for avoiding gaps in sloping walls. Slic3r keeps adding perimeters, until more than 70% of the loop immediately above is supported.

extra_perimeters_on_overhangs.label: Extra perimeters on overhangs (Experimental)
extra_perimeters_on_overhangs.tooltip: Detect overhang areas where bridges cannot be anchored, and fill them with extra perimeter paths. These paths are anchored to the nearby non-overhang area when possible.

extruder.label: Extruder
extruder.tooltip: The extruder to use (unless more specific extruder settings are specified). This value overrides perimeter and infill extruders, but not the support extruders.

extruder_clearance_height.label: Height
extruder_clearance_height.tooltip:
Only used when 'Print Settings -> Complete individual objects' is active. Set this to the vertical distance between your nozzle tip and (usually) the X carriage rods. Used to check for collisions with previously printed objects and to prevent them when arranging.
The value is ignored for most Prusa printers, which come with more detailed extruder model.

extruder_clearance_radius.label: Radius
extruder_clearance_radius.tooltip:
Only used when 'Print Settings -> Complete individual objects' is active. Set this to a radius of a nozzle-centered cylinder big enough to enclose the extruder assembly. Used to check for collisions with previously printed objects and to prevent them when arranging.
The value is ignored for most Prusa printers, which come with more detailed extruder model.

extruder_colour.label: Extruder Color
extruder_colour.tooltip: This is only used in the Slic3r interface as a visual help.

extruder_offset.label: Extruder offset
extruder_offset.tooltip: If your firmware doesn't handle the extruder displacement you need the G-code to take it into account. This option lets you specify the displacement of each extruder with respect to the first one. It expects positive coordinates (they will be subtracted from the XY coordinate).

extrusion_axis.label: Extrusion axis
extrusion_axis.tooltip: Use this option to set the axis letter associated to your printer's extruder (usually E but some printers use A).

extrusion_multiplier.label: Extrusion multiplier
extrusion_multiplier.tooltip: This factor changes the amount of flow proportionally. You may need to tweak this setting to get nice surface finish and correct single wall widths. Usual values are between 0.9 and 1.1. If you think you need to change this more, check filament diameter and your firmware E steps.

extrusion_width.label: Default extrusion width
extrusion_width.tooltip: Set this to a non-zero value to allow a manual extrusion width. If left to zero, Slic3r derives extrusion widths from the nozzle diameter (see the tooltips for perimeter extrusion width, infill extrusion width etc). If expressed as percentage (for example: 230%), it will be computed over layer height.

fan_always_on.label: Keep fan always on
fan_always_on.tooltip: If this is enabled, fan will never be disabled and will be kept running at least at its minimum speed. Useful for PLA, harmful for ABS.

fan_below_layer_time.label: Enable fan if layer print time is below
fan_below_layer_time.tooltip: If layer print time is estimated below this number of seconds, fan will be enabled and its speed will be calculated by interpolating the minimum and maximum speeds.

filament_abrasive.label: Abrasive material
filament_abrasive.tooltip: This flag means that the material is abrasive and requires a hardened nozzle. The value is used by the printer to check it.

filament_colour.label: Color
filament_colour.tooltip: This is only used in the Slic3r interface as a visual help.

filament_cooling_final_speed.label: Speed of the last cooling move
filament_cooling_final_speed.tooltip: Cooling moves are gradually accelerating towards this speed.

filament_cooling_initial_speed.label: Speed of the first cooling move
filament_cooling_initial_speed.tooltip: Cooling moves are gradually accelerating beginning at this speed.

filament_cooling_moves.label: Number of cooling moves
filament_cooling_moves.tooltip: Filament is cooled by being moved back and forth in the cooling tubes. Specify desired number of these moves.

filament_cost.label: Cost
filament_cost.tooltip: Enter your filament cost per kg here. This is only for statistical information.

filament_density.label: Density
filament_density.tooltip: Enter your filament density here. This is only for statistical information. A decent way is to weigh a known length of filament and compute the ratio of the length to volume. Better is to calculate the volume directly through displacement.

filament_deretract_speed.label: Deretraction Speed
filament_deretract_speed.tooltip: The speed for loading of a filament into extruder after retraction (it only applies to the extruder motor). If left to zero, the retraction speed is used.

filament_diameter.label: Diameter
filament_diameter.tooltip: Enter your filament diameter here. Good precision is required, so use a caliper and do multiple measurements along the filament, then compute the average.

filament_infill_max_crossing_speed.label: Max crossing infill speed
filament_infill_max_crossing_speed.tooltip: Maximum speed allowed for this filament while printing infill with self intersections in a single layer. Set to zero for no limit.

filament_infill_max_speed.label: Max non-crossing infill speed
filament_infill_max_speed.tooltip: Maximum speed allowed for this filament while printing infill without any self intersections in a single layer. Set to zero for no limit.

filament_load_time.label: Filament load time
filament_load_time.tooltip: Time for the printer firmware (or the Multi Material Unit 2.0) to load a new filament during a tool change (when executing the T code). This time is added to the total print time by the G-code time estimator.

filament_loading_speed.label: Loading speed
filament_loading_speed.tooltip: Speed used for loading the filament on the wipe tower.

filament_loading_speed_start.label: Loading speed at the start
filament_loading_speed_start.tooltip: Speed used at the very beginning of loading phase.

filament_max_volumetric_speed.label: Max volumetric speed
filament_max_volumetric_speed.tooltip: Maximum volumetric speed allowed for this filament. Limits the maximum volumetric speed of a print to the minimum of print and filament volumetric speed. Set to zero for no limit.

filament_minimal_purge_on_wipe_tower.label: Minimal purge on wipe tower
filament_minimal_purge_on_wipe_tower.tooltip: After a tool change, the exact position of the newly loaded filament inside the nozzle may not be known, and the filament pressure is likely not yet stable. Before purging the print head into an infill or a sacrificial object, Slic3r will always prime this amount of material into the wipe tower to produce successive infill or sacrificial object extrusions reliably.

filament_multitool_ramming.label: Enable ramming for multitool setups
filament_multitool_ramming.tooltip: Perform ramming when using multitool printer (i.e. when the 'Single Extruder Multimaterial' in Printer Settings is unchecked). When checked, a small amount of filament is rapidly extruded on the wipe tower just before the toolchange. This option is only used when the wipe tower is enabled.

filament_multitool_ramming_flow.label: Multitool ramming flow
filament_multitool_ramming_flow.tooltip: Flow used for ramming the filament before the toolchange.

filament_multitool_ramming_volume.label: Multitool ramming volume
filament_multitool_ramming_volume.tooltip: The volume to be rammed before the toolchange.

filament_notes.label: Filament notes
filament_notes.tooltip: You can put your notes regarding the filament here.

filament_purge_multiplier.label: Purge volume multiplier
filament_purge_multiplier.tooltip: Purging volume on the wipe tower is determined by 'multimaterial_purging' in Printer Settings. This option allows to modify the volume on filament level. Note that the project can override this by setting project-specific values.

filament_ramming_parameters.label: Ramming parameters
filament_ramming_parameters.tooltip: This string is edited by RammingDialog and contains ramming specific parameters.

filament_retract_before_travel.label: Minimum travel after retraction
filament_retract_before_travel.tooltip: Retraction is not triggered when travel moves are shorter than this length.

filament_retract_before_wipe.label: Retract amount before wipe
filament_retract_before_wipe.tooltip: With bowden extruders, it may be wise to do some amount of quick retract before doing the wipe movement.

filament_retract_layer_change.label: Retract on layer change
filament_retract_layer_change.tooltip: This flag enforces a retraction whenever a Z move is done.

filament_retract_length.label: Retraction length
filament_retract_length.tooltip: When retraction is triggered, filament is pulled back by the specified amount (the length is measured on raw filament, before it enters the extruder).

filament_retract_length_toolchange.label: Length
filament_retract_length_toolchange.tooltip: When retraction is triggered before changing tool, filament is pulled back by the specified amount (the length is measured on raw filament, before it enters the extruder).

filament_retract_lift_above.label: Above Z
filament_retract_lift_above.tooltip: If you set this to a positive value, Z lift will only take place above the specified absolute Z. You can tune this setting for skipping lift on the first layers.

filament_retract_lift_below.label: Below Z
filament_retract_lift_below.tooltip: If you set this to a positive value, Z lift will only take place below the specified absolute Z. You can tune this setting for limiting lift to the first layers.

filament_retract_restart_extra.label: Deretraction extra length
filament_retract_restart_extra.tooltip: When the retraction is compensated after the travel move, the extruder will push this additional amount of filament. This setting is rarely needed.

filament_retract_restart_extra_toolchang.label: Extra length on restart
filament_retract_restart_extra_toolchang.tooltip: When the retraction is compensated after changing tool, the extruder will push this additional amount of filament.

filament_retract_speed.label: Retraction Speed
filament_retract_speed.tooltip: The speed for retractions (it only applies to the extruder motor).

filament_seam_gap_distance.label: Seam gap distance
filament_seam_gap_distance.tooltip: The distance between the endpoints of a closed loop perimeter. Positive values will shorten and interrupt the loop slightly to reduce the seam. Negative values will extend the loop, causing the endpoints to overlap slightly. When percents are used, the distance is derived from the nozzle diameter. Set to zero to disable this feature.

filament_shrinkage_compensation_xy.label: Shrinkage compensation XY
filament_shrinkage_compensation_xy.tooltip: Enter your filament shrinkage percentages for the X and Y axes here to apply scaling of the object to compensate for shrinkage in the X and Y axes. For example, if you measured 99mm instead of 100mm, enter 1%.

filament_shrinkage_compensation_z.label: Shrinkage compensation Z
filament_shrinkage_compensation_z.tooltip: Enter your filament shrinkage percentages for the Z axis here to apply scaling of the object to compensate for shrinkage in the Z axis. For example, if you measured 99mm instead of 100mm, enter 1%.

filament_soluble.label: Soluble material
filament_soluble.tooltip: Soluble material is most likely used for a soluble support.

filament_spool_weight.label: Spool weight
filament_spool_weight.tooltip: Enter weight of the empty filament spool. One may weigh a partially consumed filament spool before printing and one may compare the measured weight with the calculated weight of the filament with the spool to find out whether the amount of filament on the spool is sufficient to finish the print.

filament_stamping_distance.label: Stamping distance measured from the center of the cooling tube
filament_stamping_distance.tooltip: If set to nonzero value, filament is moved toward the nozzle between the individual cooling moves ("stamping"). This option configures how long this movement should be before the filament is retracted again.

filament_toolchange_delay.label: Delay after unloading
filament_toolchange_delay.tooltip: Time to wait after the filament is unloaded. May help to get reliable toolchanges with flexible materials that may need more time to shrink to original dimensions.

filament_travel_lift_before_obstacle.label: Steeper ramp before obstacles
filament_travel_lift_before_obstacle.tooltip: If enabled, PrusaSlicer detects obstacles along the travel path and makes the slope steeper in case an obstacle might be hit during the initial phase of the travel.

filament_travel_max_lift.label: Maximum ramping lift
filament_travel_max_lift.tooltip: Maximum lift height of the ramping lift. It may not be reached if the next position is close to the old one.

filament_travel_ramping_lift.label: Use ramping lift
filament_travel_ramping_lift.tooltip: Generates a ramping lift instead of lifting the extruder directly upwards. The travel is split into two phases: the ramp and the standard horizontal travel. This option helps reduce stringing.

filament_travel_slope.label: Ramping slope angle
filament_travel_slope.tooltip: Slope of the ramp in the initial phase of the travel.

filament_type.label: Filament type
filament_type.tooltip: The filament material type for use in custom G-codes.

filament_unload_time.label: Filament unload time
filament_unload_time.tooltip: Time for the printer firmware (or the Multi Material Unit 2.0) to unload a filament during a tool change (when executing the T code). This time is added to the total print time by the G-code time estimator.

filament_unloading_speed.label: Unloading speed
filament_unloading_speed.tooltip: Speed used for unloading the filament on the wipe tower (does not affect  initial part of unloading just after ramming).

filament_unloading_speed_start.label: Unloading speed at the start
filament_unloading_speed_start.tooltip: Speed used for unloading the tip of the filament immediately after ramming.

filament_wipe.label: Wipe while retracting
filament_wipe.tooltip: This flag will move the nozzle while retracting to minimize the possible blob on leaky extruders.

fill_angle.label: Fill angle
fill_angle.tooltip: Default base angle for infill orientation. Cross-hatching will be applied to this. Bridges will be infilled using the best direction Slic3r can detect, so this setting does not affect them.

fill_density.label: Fill density
fill_density.tooltip: Density of internal infill, expressed in the range 0% - 100%.

fill_pattern.label: Fill pattern
fill_pattern.tooltip: Fill pattern for general low-density infill.

first_layer_acceleration.label: First layer
first_layer_acceleration.tooltip: This is the acceleration your printer will use for first layer. Set zero to disable acceleration control for first layer.

first_layer_acceleration_over_raft.label: First object layer over raft interface
first_layer_acceleration_over_raft.tooltip: This is the acceleration your printer will use for first layer of object above raft interface. Set zero to disable acceleration control for first layer of object above raft interface.

first_layer_bed_temperature.label: First layer
first_layer_bed_temperature.tooltip: Heated build plate temperature for the first layer. Set this to zero to disable bed temperature control commands in the output.

first_layer_extrusion_width.label: First layer
first_layer_extrusion_width.tooltip: Set this to a non-zero value to set a manual extrusion width for first layer. You can use this to force fatter extrudates for better adhesion. If expressed as percentage (for example 120%) it will be computed over first layer height. If set to zero, it will use the default extrusion width.

first_layer_height.label: First layer height
first_layer_height.tooltip: When printing with very low layer heights, you might still want to print a thicker bottom layer to improve adhesion and tolerance for non perfect build plates.

first_layer_infill_speed.label: First layer solid infill speed
first_layer_infill_speed.tooltip: If expressed as absolute value in mm/s, this speed will be applied to the solid infill print moves of the first layer. If expressed as a percentage (for example: 40%) it will be a percantage of the solid infill speed (for example: 40% of the solid infill speed). Note that 0 means that the "First layer speed" value will be used.

first_layer_speed.label: First layer speed
first_layer_speed.tooltip: If expressed as absolute value in mm/s, this speed will be applied to all the print moves of the first layer, regardless of their type. If expressed as a percentage (for example: 40%) it will scale the default speeds.

first_layer_speed_over_raft.label: Speed of object first layer over raft interface
first_layer_speed_over_raft.tooltip: If expressed as absolute value in mm/s, this speed will be applied to all the print moves of the first object layer above raft interface, regardless of their type. If expressed as a percentage (for example: 40%) it will scale the default speeds.

first_layer_temperature.label: First layer
first_layer_temperature.tooltip: Nozzle temperature for the first layer. If you want to control temperature manually during print, set this to zero to disable temperature control commands in the output G-code.

full_fan_speed_layer.label: Full fan speed at layer
full_fan_speed_layer.tooltip: Fan speed will be ramped up linearly from zero at layer "disable_fan_first_layers" to maximum at layer "full_fan_speed_layer". "full_fan_speed_layer" will be ignored if lower than "disable_fan_first_layers", in which case the fan will be running at maximum allowed speed at layer "disable_fan_first_layers" + 1.

fuzzy_skin_point_dist.label: Fuzzy skin point distance
fuzzy_skin_point_dist.tooltip: Perimeters will be split into multiple segments by inserting Fuzzy skin points. Lowering the Fuzzy skin point distance will increase the number of randomly offset points on the perimeter wall.

fuzzy_skin_thickness.label: Fuzzy skin thickness
fuzzy_skin_thickness.tooltip: The maximum distance that each skin point can be offset (both ways), measured perpendicular to the perimeter wall.

gap_fill_enabled.label: Fill gaps
gap_fill_enabled.tooltip: Enables filling of gaps between perimeters and between the inner most perimeters and infill.

gap_fill_speed.label: Gap fill
gap_fill_speed.tooltip: Speed for filling small gaps using short zigzag moves. Keep this reasonably low to avoid too much shaking and resonance issues. Set zero to disable gaps filling.

gcode_comments.label: Verbose G-code
gcode_comments.tooltip: Enable this to get a commented G-code file, with each line explained by a descriptive text. If you print from SD card, the additional weight of the file could make your firmware slow down.

gcode_flavor.label: G-code flavor
gcode_flavor.tooltip: Some G/M-code commands, including temperature control and others, are not universal. Set this option to your printer's firmware to get a compatible output. The "No extrusion" flavor prevents PrusaSlicer from exporting any extrusion value at all.

gcode_label_objects.label: Label objects
gcode_label_objects.tooltip:
Selects whether labels should be exported at object boundaries and in what format.
OctoPrint = comments to be consumed by OctoPrint CancelObject plugin.
Firmware = firmware specific G-code (it will be chosen based on firmware flavor and it can end up to be empty).

This settings is NOT compatible with Single Extruder Multi Material setup and Wipe into Object / Wipe into Infill.

gcode_resolution.label: G-code resolution
gcode_resolution.tooltip: Maximum deviation of exported G-code paths from their full resolution counterparts. Very high resolution G-code requires huge amount of RAM to slice and preview, also a 3D printer may stutter not being able to process a high resolution G-code in a timely manner. On the other hand, a low resolution G-code will produce a low poly effect and because the G-code reduction is performed at each layer independently, visible artifacts may be produced.

gcode_substitutions.label: G-code substitutions
gcode_substitutions.tooltip: Find / replace patterns in G-code lines and substitute them.

high_current_on_filament_swap.label: High extruder current on filament swap
high_current_on_filament_swap.tooltip: It may be beneficial to increase the extruder motor current during the filament exchange sequence to allow for rapid ramming feed rates and to overcome resistance when loading a filament with an ugly shaped tip.

host_type.label: Host Type
host_type.tooltip: Slic3r can upload G-code files to a printer host. This field must contain the kind of the host.

infill_acceleration.label: Infill
infill_acceleration.tooltip: This is the acceleration your printer will use for infill. Set zero to disable acceleration control for infill.

infill_anchor.label: Length of the infill anchor
infill_anchor.tooltip: Connect an infill line to an internal perimeter with a short segment of an additional perimeter. If expressed as percentage (example: 15%) it is calculated over infill extrusion width. PrusaSlicer tries to connect two close infill lines to a short perimeter segment. If no such perimeter segment shorter than infill_anchor_max is found, the infill line is connected to a perimeter segment at just one side and the length of the perimeter segment taken is limited to this parameter, but no longer than anchor_length_max. Set this parameter to zero to disable anchoring perimeters connected to a single infill line.

infill_anchor_max.label: Maximum length of the infill anchor
infill_anchor_max.tooltip: Connect an infill line to an internal perimeter with a short segment of an additional perimeter. If expressed as percentage (example: 15%) it is calculated over infill extrusion width. PrusaSlicer tries to connect two close infill lines to a short perimeter segment. If no such perimeter segment shorter than this parameter is found, the infill line is connected to a perimeter segment at just one side and the length of the perimeter segment taken is limited to infill_anchor, but no longer than this parameter. Set this parameter to zero to disable anchoring.

infill_every_layers.label: Combine infill every
infill_every_layers.tooltip: This feature allows to combine infill and speed up your print by extruding thicker infill layers while preserving thin perimeters, thus accuracy.

infill_extruder.label: Infill extruder
infill_extruder.tooltip: The extruder to use when printing infill.

infill_extrusion_width.label: Infill
infill_extrusion_width.tooltip: Set this to a non-zero value to set a manual extrusion width for infill. If left zero, default extrusion width will be used if set, otherwise 1.125 x nozzle diameter will be used. You may want to use fatter extrudates to speed up the infill and make your parts stronger. If expressed as percentage (for example 90%) it will be computed over layer height.

infill_first.label: Infill before perimeters
infill_first.tooltip: This option will switch the print order of perimeters and infill, making the latter first.

infill_overlap.label: Infill/perimeters overlap
infill_overlap.tooltip: This setting applies an additional overlap between infill and perimeters for better bonding. Theoretically this shouldn't be needed, but backlash might cause gaps. If expressed as percentage (example: 15%) it is calculated over perimeter extrusion width.

infill_speed.label: Infill
infill_speed.tooltip: Speed for printing the internal fill. Set to zero for auto.

inherits.label: Inherits profile
inherits.tooltip: Name of the profile, from which this profile inherits.

interface_shells.label: Interface shells
interface_shells.tooltip: Force the generation of solid shells between adjacent materials/volumes. Useful for multi-extruder prints with translucent materials or manual soluble support material.

interlocking_beam.label: Use beam interlocking
interlocking_beam.tooltip: Generate interlocking beam structure at the locations where different filaments touch. This improves the adhesion between filaments, especially models printed in different materials.

interlocking_beam_layer_count.label: Interlocking beam layers
interlocking_beam_layer_count.tooltip: The height of the beams of the interlocking structure, measured in number of layers. Less layers is stronger, but more prone to defects.

interlocking_beam_width.label: Interlocking beam width
interlocking_beam_width.tooltip: The width of the interlocking structure beams.

interlocking_boundary_avoidance.label: Interlocking boundary avoidance
interlocking_boundary_avoidance.tooltip: The distance from the outside of a model where interlocking structures will not be generated, measured in cells.

interlocking_depth.label: Interlocking depth
interlocking_depth.tooltip: The distance from the boundary between filaments to generate interlocking structure, measured in cells. Too few cells will result in poor adhesion.

ironing.label: Enable ironing
ironing.tooltip: Enable ironing of the top layers with the hot print head for smooth surface

ironing_flowrate.label: Flow rate
ironing_flowrate.tooltip: Percent of a flow rate relative to object's normal layer height.

layer_gcode.label: After layer change G-code
layer_gcode.tooltip: This custom code is inserted at every layer change, right after the Z move and before the extruder moves to the first layer point. Note that you can use placeholder variables for all Slic3r settings as well as [layer_num] and [layer_z].

layer_height.label: Layer height
layer_height.tooltip: This setting controls the height (and thus the total number) of the slices/layers. Thinner layers give better accuracy but take more time to print.

machine_limits_usage.label: How to apply limits
machine_limits_usage.tooltip: How to apply the Machine Limits

machine_max_acceleration_e.tooltip: Maximum acceleration of the E axis

machine_max_acceleration_retracting.tooltip:
Maximum acceleration when retracting.

Not used for RepRapFirmware, which does not support it.

machine_max_acceleration_x.tooltip: Maximum acceleration of the X axis

machine_max_acceleration_y.tooltip: Maximum acceleration of the Y axis

machine_max_acceleration_z.tooltip: Maximum acceleration of the Z axis

machine_max_feedrate_e.tooltip: Maximum feedrate of the E axis

machine_max_feedrate_x.tooltip: Maximum feedrate of the X axis

machine_max_feedrate_y.tooltip: Maximum feedrate of the Y axis

machine_max_feedrate_z.tooltip: Maximum feedrate of the Z axis

machine_max_jerk_e.tooltip: Maximum jerk of the E axis

machine_max_jerk_x.tooltip: Maximum jerk of the X axis

machine_max_jerk_y.tooltip: Maximum jerk of the Y axis

machine_max_jerk_z.tooltip: Maximum jerk of the Z axis

max_fan_speed.label: Max
max_fan_speed.tooltip: This setting represents the maximum speed of your fan.

max_layer_height.label: Max
max_layer_height.tooltip: This is the highest printable layer height for this extruder, used to cap the variable layer height and support layer height. Maximum recommended layer height is 75% of the extrusion width to achieve reasonable inter-layer adhesion. If set to 0, layer height is limited to 75% of the nozzle diameter.

max_print_height.label: Max print height
max_print_height.tooltip: Set this to the maximum height that can be reached by your extruder while printing.

max_print_speed.label: Max print speed
max_print_speed.tooltip: When setting other speed settings to 0 Slic3r will autocalculate the optimal speed in order to keep constant extruder pressure. This experimental setting is used to set the highest print speed you want to allow.

max_volumetric_extrusion_rate_slope_nega.label: Max volumetric slope negative
max_volumetric_extrusion_rate_slope_nega.tooltip: This experimental setting is used to limit the speed of change in extrusion rate for a transition from higher speed to lower speed. A value of 1.8 mm³/s² ensures, that a change from the extrusion rate of 5.4 mm³/s (0.45 mm extrusion width, 0.2 mm extrusion height, feedrate 60 mm/s) to 1.8 mm³/s (feedrate 20 mm/s) will take at least 2 seconds.

max_volumetric_extrusion_rate_slope_posi.label: Max volumetric slope positive
max_volumetric_extrusion_rate_slope_posi.tooltip: This experimental setting is used to limit the speed of change in extrusion rate for a transition from lower speed to higher speed. A value of 1.8 mm³/s² ensures, that a change from the extrusion rate of 1.8 mm³/s (0.45 mm extrusion width, 0.2 mm extrusion height, feedrate 20 mm/s) to 5.4 mm³/s (feedrate 60 mm/s) will take at least 2 seconds.

max_volumetric_speed.label: Max volumetric speed
max_volumetric_speed.tooltip: This experimental setting is used to set the maximum volumetric speed your extruder supports.

min_bead_width.label: Minimum perimeter width
min_bead_width.tooltip: Width of the perimeter that will replace thin features (according to the Minimum feature size) of the model. If the Minimum perimeter width is thinner than the thickness of the feature, the perimeter will become as thick as the feature itself. If expressed as a percentage (for example 85%), it will be computed based on the nozzle diameter.

min_fan_speed.label: Min
min_fan_speed.tooltip: This setting represents the minimum PWM your fan needs to work.

min_feature_size.label: Minimum feature size
min_feature_size.tooltip: Minimum thickness of thin features. Model features that are thinner than this value will not be printed, while features thicker than the Minimum feature size will be widened to the Minimum perimeter width. If expressed as a percentage (for example 25%), it will be computed based on the nozzle diameter.

min_layer_height.label: Min
min_layer_height.tooltip: This is the lowest printable layer height for this extruder and limits the resolution for variable layer height. Typical values are between 0.05 mm and 0.1 mm.

min_print_speed.label: Min print speed
min_print_speed.tooltip: Slic3r will not scale speed down below this speed.

min_skirt_length.label: Minimal filament extrusion length
min_skirt_length.tooltip: Generate no less than the number of skirt loops required to consume the specified amount of filament on the bottom layer. For multi-extruder machines, this minimum applies to each extruder.

mmu_segmented_region_interlocking_depth.label: Interlocking depth of a segmented region
mmu_segmented_region_interlocking_depth.tooltip: Interlocking depth of a segmented region. It will be ignored if "mmu_segmented_region_max_width" is zero or if "mmu_segmented_region_interlocking_depth"is bigger then "mmu_segmented_region_max_width". Zero disables this feature.

mmu_segmented_region_max_width.label: Maximum width of a segmented region
mmu_segmented_region_max_width.tooltip: Maximum width of a segmented region. Zero disables this feature.

multimaterial_purging.label: Purging volume
multimaterial_purging.tooltip: Determines purging volume on the wipe tower. This can be modified in Filament Settings ('filament_purge_multiplier') or overridden using project-specific settings.

notes.label: Configuration notes
notes.tooltip: You can put here your personal notes. This text will be added to the G-code header comments.

nozzle_diameter.label: Nozzle diameter
nozzle_diameter.tooltip: This is the diameter of your extruder nozzle (for example: 0.5, 0.35 etc.)

nozzle_high_flow.label: High flow nozzle
nozzle_high_flow.tooltip: High flow nozzles allow higher print speeds.

only_one_perimeter_first_layer.label: Only one perimeter on first layer
only_one_perimeter_first_layer.tooltip: Use only one perimeter on the first layer.

only_retract_when_crossing_perimeters.label: Only retract when crossing perimeters
only_retract_when_crossing_perimeters.tooltip: Disables retraction when the travel path does not exceed the upper layer's perimeters (and thus any ooze will be probably invisible).

ooze_prevention.label: Enable
ooze_prevention.tooltip: This option will drop the temperature of the inactive extruders to prevent oozing.

output_filename_format.label: Output filename format
output_filename_format.tooltip: You can use all configuration options as variables inside this template. For example: [layer_height], [fill_density] etc. You can also use [timestamp], [year], [month], [day], [hour], [minute], [second], [version], [input_filename_base], [default_output_extension].

over_bridge_speed.label: Over bridges
over_bridge_speed.tooltip: Speed for printing solid infill above bridges. Set to 0 to use solid infill speed. If set as percentage, the speed is calculated over solid infill speed.

overhang_fan_speed_0.label: speed for 0% overlap (bridge)
overhang_fan_speed_0.tooltip: Overhang size is expressed as a percentage of overlap of the extrusion with the previous layer: 100% would be full overlap (no overhang), while 0% represents full overhang (floating extrusion, bridge). Fan speeds for overhang sizes in between are calculated via linear interpolation.

overhang_fan_speed_1.label: speed for 25% overlap
overhang_fan_speed_1.tooltip: Overhang size is expressed as a percentage of overlap of the extrusion with the previous layer: 100% would be full overlap (no overhang), while 0% represents full overhang (floating extrusion, bridge). Fan speeds for overhang sizes in between are calculated via linear interpolation.

overhang_fan_speed_2.label: speed for 50% overlap
overhang_fan_speed_2.tooltip: Overhang size is expressed as a percentage of overlap of the extrusion with the previous layer: 100% would be full overlap (no overhang), while 0% represents full overhang (floating extrusion, bridge). Fan speeds for overhang sizes in between are calculated via linear interpolation.

overhang_fan_speed_3.label: speed for 75% overlap
overhang_fan_speed_3.tooltip: Overhang size is expressed as a percentage of overlap of the extrusion with the previous layer: 100% would be full overlap (no overhang), while 0% represents full overhang (floating extrusion, bridge). Fan speeds for overhang sizes in between are calculated via linear interpolation.

overhang_speed_0.label: speed for 0% overlap (bridge)
overhang_speed_0.tooltip: Overhang size is expressed as a percentage of overlap of the extrusion with the previous layer: 100% would be full overlap (no overhang), while 0% represents full overhang (floating extrusion, bridge). Speeds for overhang sizes in between are calculated via linear interpolation. If set as percentage, the speed is calculated over the external perimeter speed. Note that the speeds generated to gcode will never exceed the max volumetric speed value.

overhang_speed_1.label: speed for 25% overlap
overhang_speed_1.tooltip: Overhang size is expressed as a percentage of overlap of the extrusion with the previous layer: 100% would be full overlap (no overhang), while 0% represents full overhang (floating extrusion, bridge). Speeds for overhang sizes in between are calculated via linear interpolation. If set as percentage, the speed is calculated over the external perimeter speed. Note that the speeds generated to gcode will never exceed the max volumetric speed value.

overhang_speed_2.label: speed for 50% overlap
overhang_speed_2.tooltip: Overhang size is expressed as a percentage of overlap of the extrusion with the previous layer: 100% would be full overlap (no overhang), while 0% represents full overhang (floating extrusion, bridge). Speeds for overhang sizes in between are calculated via linear interpolation. If set as percentage, the speed is calculated over the external perimeter speed. Note that the speeds generated to gcode will never exceed the max volumetric speed value.

overhang_speed_3.label: speed for 75% overlap
overhang_speed_3.tooltip: Overhang size is expressed as a percentage of overlap of the extrusion with the previous layer: 100% would be full overlap (no overhang), while 0% represents full overhang (floating extrusion, bridge). Speeds for overhang sizes in between are calculated via linear interpolation. If set as percentage, the speed is calculated over the external perimeter speed. Note that the speeds generated to gcode will never exceed the max volumetric speed value.

overhangs.label: Detect bridging perimeters
overhangs.tooltip: Experimental option to adjust flow for overhangs (bridge flow will be used), to apply bridge speed to them and enable fan.

parking_pos_retraction.label: Filament parking position
parking_pos_retraction.tooltip: Distance of the extruder tip from the position where the filament is parked when unloaded. This should match the value in printer firmware.

pause_print_gcode.label: Pause Print G-code
pause_print_gcode.tooltip: This G-code will be used as a code for the pause print

perimeter_acceleration.label: Perimeters
perimeter_acceleration.tooltip: This is the acceleration your printer will use for perimeters. Set zero to disable acceleration control for perimeters.

perimeter_extruder.label: Perimeter extruder
perimeter_extruder.tooltip: The extruder to use when printing perimeters and brim. First extruder is 1.

perimeter_extrusion_width.label: Perimeters
perimeter_extrusion_width.tooltip: Set this to a non-zero value to set a manual extrusion width for perimeters. You may want to use thinner extrudates to get more accurate surfaces. If left zero, default extrusion width will be used if set, otherwise 1.125 x nozzle diameter will be used. If expressed as percentage (for example 200%) it will be computed over layer height.

perimeter_generator.label: Perimeter generator
perimeter_generator.tooltip: Classic perimeter generator produces perimeters with constant extrusion width and for very thin areas is used gap-fill. Arachne engine produces perimeters with variable extrusion width. This setting also affects the Concentric infill.

perimeter_speed.label: Perimeters
perimeter_speed.tooltip: Speed for perimeters (contours, aka vertical shells). Set to zero for auto.

perimeters.label: Perimeters
perimeters.tooltip: This option sets the number of perimeters to generate for each layer. Note that Slic3r may increase this number automatically when it detects sloping surfaces which benefit from a higher number of perimeters if the Extra Perimeters option is enabled.

post_process.label: Post-processing scripts
post_process.tooltip: If you want to process the output G-code through custom scripts, just list their absolute paths here. Separate multiple scripts with a semicolon. Scripts will be passed the absolute path to the G-code file as the first argument, and they can access the Slic3r config settings by reading environment variables.

prefer_clockwise_movements.label: Prefer clockwise movements
prefer_clockwise_movements.tooltip: This setting makes the printer print loops clockwise instead of counterclockwise.

preset_names.label: Printer preset names
preset_names.tooltip: Names of presets related to the physical printer

print_host.label: Hostname, IP or URL
print_host.tooltip: Slic3r can upload G-code files to a printer host. This field should contain the hostname, IP address or URL of the printer host instance. Print host behind HAProxy with basic auth enabled can be accessed by putting the user name and password into the URL in the following format: https://username:password@your-octopi-address/

printer_notes.label: Printer notes
printer_notes.tooltip: You can put your notes regarding the printer here.

printer_variant.label: Printer variant
printer_variant.tooltip: Name of the printer variant. For example, the printer variants may be differentiated by a nozzle diameter.

printhost_apikey.label: API Key / Password
printhost_apikey.tooltip: Slic3r can upload G-code files to a printer host. This field should contain the API Key or the password required for authentication.

printhost_cafile.label: HTTPS CA File
printhost_cafile.tooltip: Custom CA certificate file can be specified for HTTPS OctoPrint connections, in crt/pem format. If left blank, the default OS CA certificate repository is used.

printhost_ssl_ignore_revoke.label: Ignore HTTPS certificate revocation checks
printhost_ssl_ignore_revoke.tooltip: Ignore HTTPS certificate revocation checks in case of missing or offline distribution points. One may want to enable this option for self signed certificates if connection fails.

raft_contact_distance.label: Raft contact Z distance
raft_contact_distance.tooltip: The vertical distance between object and raft. Ignored for soluble interface.

raft_expansion.label: Raft expansion
raft_expansion.tooltip: Expansion of the raft in XY plane for better stability.

raft_first_layer_density.label: First layer density
raft_first_layer_density.tooltip: Density of the first raft or support layer.

raft_first_layer_expansion.label: First layer expansion
raft_first_layer_expansion.tooltip: Expansion of the first raft or support layer to improve adhesion to print bed.

raft_layers.label: Raft layers
raft_layers.tooltip: The object will be raised by this number of layers, and support material will be generated under it.

remaining_times.label: Supports remaining times
remaining_times.tooltip: Emit M73 P[percent printed] R[remaining time in minutes] at 1 minute intervals into the G-code to let the firmware show accurate remaining time. As of now only the Prusa i3 MK3 firmware recognizes M73. Also the i3 MK3 firmware supports M73 Qxx Sxx for the silent mode.

resolution.label: Slice resolution
resolution.tooltip: Minimum detail resolution, used to simplify the input file for speeding up the slicing job and reducing memory usage. High-resolution models often carry more detail than printers can render. Set to zero to disable any simplification and use full resolution from input.

retract_before_travel.label: Minimum travel after retraction
retract_before_travel.tooltip: Retraction is not triggered when travel moves are shorter than this length.

retract_before_wipe.label: Retract amount before wipe
retract_before_wipe.tooltip: With bowden extruders, it may be wise to do some amount of quick retract before doing the wipe movement.

retract_layer_change.label: Retract on layer change
retract_layer_change.tooltip: This flag enforces a retraction whenever a Z move is done.

retract_length.label: Retraction length
retract_length.tooltip: When retraction is triggered, filament is pulled back by the specified amount (the length is measured on raw filament, before it enters the extruder).

retract_length_toolchange.label: Length
retract_length_toolchange.tooltip: When retraction is triggered before changing tool, filament is pulled back by the specified amount (the length is measured on raw filament, before it enters the extruder).

retract_lift_above.label: Above Z
retract_lift_above.tooltip: If you set this to a positive value, Z lift will only take place above the specified absolute Z. You can tune this setting for skipping lift on the first layers.

retract_lift_below.label: Below Z
retract_lift_below.tooltip: If you set this to a positive value, Z lift will only take place below the specified absolute Z. You can tune this setting for limiting lift to the first layers.

retract_restart_extra.label: Deretraction extra length
retract_restart_extra.tooltip: When the retraction is compensated after the travel move, the extruder will push this additional amount of filament. This setting is rarely needed.

retract_restart_extra_toolchange.label: Extra length on restart
retract_restart_extra_toolchange.tooltip: When the retraction is compensated after changing tool, the extruder will push this additional amount of filament.

retract_speed.label: Retraction Speed
retract_speed.tooltip: The speed for retractions (it only applies to the extruder motor).

scarf_seam_entire_loop.label: Scarf joint around entire perimeter
scarf_seam_entire_loop.tooltip: Extend the scarf around entire length of the perimeter.

scarf_seam_max_segment_length.label: Max scarf joint segment length
scarf_seam_max_segment_length.tooltip: Maximum length of any scarf joint segment.

scarf_seam_on_inner_perimeters.label: Scarf joint on inner perimeters
scarf_seam_on_inner_perimeters.tooltip: Use scarf joint on inner perimeters.

scarf_seam_only_on_smooth.label: Scarf joint only on smooth perimeters
scarf_seam_only_on_smooth.tooltip: Only use the scarf joint when the perimeter is smooth.

scarf_seam_placement.label: Scarf joint placement
scarf_seam_placement.tooltip: Where to place scarf joint seam.

scarf_seam_start_height.label: Scarf start height
scarf_seam_start_height.tooltip: Start height of the scarf joint specified as fraction of the current layer height.

seam_gap_distance.label: Seam gap distance
seam_gap_distance.tooltip: The distance between the endpoints of a closed loop perimeter. Positive values will shorten and interrupt the loop slightly to reduce the seam. Negative values will extend the loop, causing the endpoints to overlap slightly. When percents are used, the distance is derived from the nozzle diameter. Set to zero to disable this feature.

single_extruder_multi_material.label: Single Extruder Multi Material
single_extruder_multi_material.tooltip: The printer multiplexes filaments into a single hot end.

single_extruder_multi_material_priming.label: Prime all printing extruders
single_extruder_multi_material_priming.tooltip: If enabled, all printing extruders will be primed at the front edge of the print bed at the start of the print.

skirt_distance.label: Distance from brim/object
skirt_distance.tooltip: Distance between skirt and brim (when draft shield is not used) or objects.

skirt_height.label: Skirt height
skirt_height.tooltip: Height of skirt expressed in layers.

skirts.label: Loops (minimum)
skirts.tooltip: Number of loops for the skirt. If the Minimum Extrusion Length option is set, the number of loops might be greater than the one configured here. Set this to zero to disable skirt completely.

slice_closing_radius.label: Slice gap closing radius
slice_closing_radius.tooltip: Cracks smaller than 2x gap closing radius are being filled during the triangle mesh slicing. The gap closing operation may reduce the final print resolution, therefore it is advisable to keep the value reasonably low.

slicing_mode.label: Slicing Mode
slicing_mode.tooltip: Use "Even-odd" for 3DLabPrint airplane models. Use "Close holes" to close all holes in the model.

slowdown_below_layer_time.label: Slow down if layer print time is below
slowdown_below_layer_time.tooltip: If layer print time is estimated below this number of seconds, print moves speed will be scaled down to extend duration to this value.

small_perimeter_speed.label: Small perimeters
small_perimeter_speed.tooltip: This separate setting will affect the speed of perimeters having radius <= 6.5mm (usually holes). If expressed as percentage (for example: 80%) it will be calculated on the perimeters speed setting above. Set to zero for auto.

solid_infill_acceleration.label: Solid infill
solid_infill_acceleration.tooltip: This is the acceleration your printer will use for solid infill. Set zero to use the value for infill.

solid_infill_below_area.label: Solid infill threshold area
solid_infill_below_area.tooltip: Force solid infill for regions having a smaller area than the specified threshold.

solid_infill_every_layers.label: Solid infill every
solid_infill_every_layers.tooltip: This feature allows to force a solid layer every given number of layers. Zero to disable. You can set this to any value (for example 9999); Slic3r will automatically choose the maximum possible number of layers to combine according to nozzle diameter and layer height.

solid_infill_extruder.label: Solid infill extruder
solid_infill_extruder.tooltip: The extruder to use when printing solid infill.

solid_infill_extrusion_width.label: Solid infill
solid_infill_extrusion_width.tooltip: Set this to a non-zero value to set a manual extrusion width for infill for solid surfaces. If left zero, default extrusion width will be used if set, otherwise 1.125 x nozzle diameter will be used. If expressed as percentage (for example 90%) it will be computed over layer height.

solid_infill_speed.label: Solid infill
solid_infill_speed.tooltip: Speed for printing solid regions (top/bottom/internal horizontal shells). This can be expressed as a percentage (for example: 80%) over the default infill speed above. Set to zero for auto.

solid_layers.label: Solid layers
solid_layers.tooltip: Number of solid layers to generate on top and bottom surfaces.

solid_min_thickness.label: Minimum thickness of a top / bottom shell
solid_min_thickness.tooltip: Minimum thickness of a top / bottom shell

spiral_vase.label: Spiral vase
spiral_vase.tooltip: This feature will raise Z gradually while printing a single-walled object in order to remove any visible seam. This option requires a single perimeter, no infill, no top solid layers and no support material. You can still set any number of bottom solid layers as well as skirt/brim loops. It won't work when printing more than one single object.

staggered_inner_seams.label: Staggered inner seams
staggered_inner_seams.tooltip: This option causes the inner seams to be shifted backwards based on their depth, forming a zigzag pattern.

standby_temperature_delta.label: Temperature variation
standby_temperature_delta.tooltip: Temperature difference to be applied when an extruder is not active. The value is not used when 'idle_temperature' in filament settings is defined.

start_filament_gcode.label: Start G-code
start_filament_gcode.tooltip: This start procedure is inserted at the beginning, after any printer start gcode (and after any toolchange to this filament in case of multi-material printers). This is used to override settings for a specific filament. If PrusaSlicer detects M104, M109, M140 or M190 in your custom codes, such commands will not be prepended automatically so you're free to customize the order of heating commands and other custom actions. Note that you can use placeholder variables for all PrusaSlicer settings, so you can put a "M109 S[first_layer_temperature]" command wherever you want. If you have multiple extruders, the gcode is processed in extruder order.

start_gcode.label: Start G-code
start_gcode.tooltip: This start procedure is inserted at the beginning, possibly prepended by temperature-changing commands. See 'autoemit_temperature_commands'.
start_gcode.default_value: G28 ; home all axes\nG1 Z5 F5000 ; lift nozzle\n

support_material_angle.label: Pattern angle
support_material_angle.tooltip: Use this setting to rotate the support material pattern on the horizontal plane.

support_material_auto.label: Auto generated supports
support_material_auto.tooltip: If checked, supports will be generated automatically based on the overhang threshold value. If unchecked, supports will be generated inside the "Support Enforcer" volumes only.

support_material_bottom_contact_distance.label: Bottom contact Z distance
support_material_bottom_contact_distance.tooltip: The vertical distance between the object top surface and the support material interface. If set to zero, support_material_contact_distance will be used for both top and bottom contact Z distances.

support_material_bottom_interface_layers.label: Bottom interface layers
support_material_bottom_interface_layers.tooltip: Number of interface layers to insert between the object(s) and support material. Set to -1 to use support_material_interface_layers

support_material_buildplate_only.label: Support on build plate only
support_material_buildplate_only.tooltip: Only create support if it lies on a build plate. Don't create support on a print.

support_material_closing_radius.label: Closing radius
support_material_closing_radius.tooltip: For snug supports, the support regions will be merged using morphological closing operation. Gaps smaller than the closing radius will be filled in.

support_material_contact_distance.label: Top contact Z distance
support_material_contact_distance.tooltip: The vertical distance between object and support material interface. Setting this to 0 will also prevent Slic3r from using bridge flow and speed for the first object layer.

support_material_enforce_layers.label: Enforce support for the first
support_material_enforce_layers.full_label: Enforce support for the first n layers
support_material_enforce_layers.tooltip: Generate support material for the specified number of layers counting from bottom, regardless of whether normal support material is enabled or not and regardless of any angle threshold. This is useful for getting more adhesion of objects having a very thin or poor footprint on the build plate.

support_material_extruder.label: Support material/raft/skirt extruder
support_material_extruder.tooltip: The extruder to use when printing support material, raft and skirt (1+, 0 to use the current extruder to minimize tool changes).

support_material_extrusion_width.label: Support material
support_material_extrusion_width.tooltip: Set this to a non-zero value to set a manual extrusion width for support material. If left zero, default extrusion width will be used if set, otherwise nozzle diameter will be used. If expressed as percentage (for example 90%) it will be computed over layer height.

support_material_interface_contact_loops.label: Interface loops
support_material_interface_contact_loops.tooltip: Cover the top contact layer of the supports with loops. Disabled by default.

support_material_interface_extruder.label: Support material/raft interface extruder
support_material_interface_extruder.tooltip: The extruder to use when printing support material interface (1+, 0 to use the current extruder to minimize tool changes). This affects raft too.

support_material_interface_layers.label: Top interface layers
support_material_interface_layers.tooltip: Number of interface layers to insert between the object(s) and support material.

support_material_interface_pattern.label: Interface pattern
support_material_interface_pattern.tooltip: Pattern used to generate support material interface. Default pattern for non-soluble support interface is Rectilinear, while default pattern for soluble support interface is Concentric.

support_material_interface_spacing.label: Interface pattern spacing
support_material_interface_spacing.tooltip: Spacing between interface lines. Set zero to get a solid interface.

support_material_interface_speed.label: Support material interface
support_material_interface_speed.tooltip: Speed for printing support material interface layers. If expressed as percentage (for example 50%) it will be calculated over support material speed.

support_material_pattern.label: Pattern
support_material_pattern.tooltip: Pattern used to generate support material.

support_material_style.label: Style
support_material_style.tooltip: Style and shape of the support towers. Projecting the supports into a regular grid will create more stable supports, while snug support towers will save material and reduce object scarring.

support_material_synchronize_layers.label: Synchronize with object layers
support_material_synchronize_layers.tooltip: Synchronize support layers with the object print layers. This is useful with multi-material printers, where the extruder switch is expensive. This option is only available when top contact Z distance is set to zero.

support_material_threshold.label: Overhang threshold
support_material_threshold.tooltip: Support material will not be generated for overhangs whose slope angle (90° = vertical) is above the given threshold. In other words, this value represent the most horizontal slope (measured from the horizontal plane) that you can print without support material. Set to zero for automatic detection (recommended).

support_material_with_sheath.label: With sheath around the support
support_material_with_sheath.tooltip: Add a sheath (a single perimeter line) around the base support. This makes the support more reliable, but also more difficult to remove.

support_material_xy_spacing.label: XY separation between an object and its support
support_material_xy_spacing.tooltip: XY separation between an object and its support. If expressed as percentage (for example 50%), it will be calculated over external perimeter width.

support_tree_angle.label: Maximum Branch Angle
support_tree_angle.tooltip: The maximum angle of the branches, when the branches have to avoid the model. Use a lower angle to make them more vertical and more stable. Use a higher angle to be able to have more reach.

support_tree_angle_slow.label: Preferred Branch Angle
support_tree_angle_slow.tooltip: The preferred angle of the branches, when they do not have to avoid the model. Use a lower angle to make them more vertical and more stable. Use a higher angle for branches to merge faster.

support_tree_branch_diameter.label: Branch Diameter
support_tree_branch_diameter.tooltip: The diameter of the thinnest branches of organic support. Thicker branches are more sturdy. Branches towards the base will be thicker than this.

support_tree_branch_diameter_angle.label: Branch Diameter Angle
support_tree_branch_diameter_angle.tooltip: The angle of the branches' diameter as they gradually become thicker towards the bottom. An angle of 0 will cause the branches to have uniform thickness over their length. A bit of an angle can increase stability of the organic support.

support_tree_branch_diameter_double_wall.label: Branch Diameter with double walls
support_tree_branch_diameter_double_wall.tooltip: Branches with area larger than the area of a circle of this diameter will be printed with double walls for stability. Set this value to zero for no double walls.

support_tree_branch_distance.label: Branch Distance
support_tree_branch_distance.tooltip: How far apart the branches need to be when they touch the model. Making this distance small will cause the tree support to touch the model at more points, causing better overhang but making support harder to remove.

support_tree_tip_diameter.label: Tip Diameter
support_tree_tip_diameter.tooltip: Branch tip diameter for organic supports.

support_tree_top_rate.label: Branch Density
support_tree_top_rate.tooltip: Adjusts the density of the support structure used to generate the tips of the branches. A higher value results in better overhangs but the supports are harder to remove, thus it is recommended to enable top support interfaces instead of a high branch density value if dense interfaces are needed.

temperature.label: Other layers
temperature.tooltip: Nozzle temperature for layers after the first one. Set this to zero to disable temperature control commands in the output G-code.

template_custom_gcode.label: Custom G-code
template_custom_gcode.tooltip: This G-code will be used as a custom code

thick_bridges.label: Thick bridges
thick_bridges.tooltip: If enabled, bridges are more reliable, can bridge longer distances, but may look worse. If disabled, bridges look better but are reliable just for shorter bridged distances.

thin_walls.label: Detect thin walls
thin_walls.tooltip: Detect single-width walls (parts where two extrusions don't fit and we need to collapse them into a single trace).

thumbnails.label: G-code thumbnails
thumbnails.tooltip:
Picture sizes to be stored into a .gcode / .bgcode and .sl1 / .sl1s files, in the following format: "XxY/EXT, XxY/EXT, ..."
Currently supported extensions are PNG, QOI and JPG.

thumbnails_format.label: Format of G-code thumbnails
thumbnails_format.tooltip: Format of G-code thumbnails: PNG for best quality, JPG for smallest size, QOI for low memory firmware

toolchange_gcode.label: Tool change G-code
toolchange_gcode.tooltip: This custom code is inserted before every toolchange. Placeholder variables for all PrusaSlicer settings as well as {toolchange_z}, {previous_extruder} and {next_extruder} can be used. When a tool-changing command which changes to the correct extruder is included (such as T{next_extruder}), PrusaSlicer will emit no other such command. It is therefore possible to script custom behaviour both before and after the toolchange.

top_fill_pattern.label: Top fill pattern
top_fill_pattern.tooltip: Fill pattern for top infill. This only affects the top visible layer, and not its adjacent solid shells.

top_infill_extrusion_width.label: Top solid infill
top_infill_extrusion_width.tooltip: Set this to a non-zero value to set a manual extrusion width for infill for top surfaces. You may want to use thinner extrudates to fill all narrow regions and get a smoother finish. If left zero, default extrusion width will be used if set, otherwise nozzle diameter will be used. If expressed as percentage (for example 90%) it will be computed over layer height.

top_one_perimeter_type.label: Single perimeter on top surfaces
top_one_perimeter_type.tooltip: Use only one perimeter on flat top surface, to give more space to the top infill pattern. Could be applied on topmost surface or all top surfaces.

top_solid_infill_acceleration.label: Top solid infill
top_solid_infill_acceleration.tooltip: This is the acceleration your printer will use for top solid infill. Set zero to use the value for solid infill.

top_solid_infill_speed.label: Top solid infill
top_solid_infill_speed.tooltip: Speed for printing top solid layers (it only applies to the uppermost external layers and not to their internal solid layers). You may want to slow down this to get a nicer surface finish. This can be expressed as a percentage (for example: 80%) over the solid infill speed above. Set to zero for auto.

top_solid_layers.label: Top
top_solid_layers.tooltip: Number of solid layers to generate on top surfaces.

top_solid_min_thickness.label: Top
top_solid_min_thickness.tooltip: The number of top solid layers is increased above top_solid_layers if necessary to satisfy minimum thickness of top shell. This is useful to prevent pillowing effect when printing with variable layer height.

travel_acceleration.label: Travel
travel_acceleration.tooltip: This is the acceleration your printer will use for travel moves. Set zero to disable acceleration control for travel.

travel_lift_before_obstacle.label: Steeper ramp before obstacles
travel_lift_before_obstacle.tooltip: If enabled, PrusaSlicer detects obstacles along the travel path and makes the slope steeper in case an obstacle might be hit during the initial phase of the travel.

travel_max_lift.label: Maximum ramping lift
travel_max_lift.tooltip: Maximum lift height of the ramping lift. It may not be reached if the next position is close to the old one.

travel_ramping_lift.label: Use ramping lift
travel_ramping_lift.tooltip: Generates a ramping lift instead of lifting the extruder directly upwards. The travel is split into two phases: the ramp and the standard horizontal travel. This option helps reduce stringing.

travel_short_distance_acceleration.label: Travel short distance acceleration
travel_short_distance_acceleration.tooltip: Acceleration used for short travel moves. Short travel distance is determined by the retract_before_travel setting.

travel_slope.label: Ramping slope angle
travel_slope.tooltip: Slope of the ramp in the initial phase of the travel.

travel_speed.label: Travel
travel_speed.tooltip: Speed for travel moves (jumps between distant extrusion points).

travel_speed_z.label: Z travel
travel_speed_z.tooltip:
Speed for movements along the Z axis.
When set to zero, the value is ignored and regular travel speed is used instead.

use_firmware_retraction.label: Use firmware retraction
use_firmware_retraction.tooltip: This setting uses G10 and G11 commands to have the firmware handle the retraction. Note that this has to be supported by firmware.

use_relative_e_distances.label: Use relative E distances
